intro: Balaustion grandibracteatum subsp. juncturum, commonly known as the African violet, is a species of flowering plant native to eastern and southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring a short, thick rhizome and a rosette of velvety, waxy leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white, which bloom throughout the year under suitable conditions. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. This subspecies is popular as a houseplant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
